metadata.title: Concept Coverage Report: Graph Universe Thesis
metadata.description: Evidence coverage metrics for each concept in the graph universe thesis

C_GRAPH_UNIVERSE_PRIMARY.name: Graph Universe (Σ) is Primary
C_GRAPH_UNIVERSE_PRIMARY.definition: Graph (ontology) is primary; code is a projection from ontology and invariants
C_GRAPH_UNIVERSE_PRIMARY.evidence_summary: Extensively documented in ARXIV paper with formal definitions in extended thesis. Graph universe Σ appears as primary state container in both documentation and implementation.

C_CODE_AS_PROJECTION.name: Code as Projection from Graph
C_CODE_AS_PROJECTION.definition: Code is treated as a derived surface (projection), not authorial input
C_CODE_AS_PROJECTION.evidence_summary: Projection operators (Π) explicitly defined with three categories: Π_human, Π_agent, Π_debug. Mathematical proof of monoid homomorphism property for projection composition.

C_RECEIPTS_AND_PROOFS.name: Receipts and Proof-Carrying Operations
C_RECEIPTS_AND_PROOFS.definition: Each action leaves a receipt with timing, evidence, and hash linkage enabling audit trails
C_RECEIPTS_AND_PROOFS.evidence_summary: Receipt field (Γ) fully formalized with nanosecond timestamps, guard verification, invariant preservation proof, and timing validation. Implemented via 1,572+ validated OpenTelemetry spans at 92.6% success rate.

C_MU_KERNEL_PHYSICS.name: μ-Kernel: Local Rules and Operations
C_MU_KERNEL_PHYSICS.definition: μ-kernel defines allowed operations and their timing bounds as local transformation rules
C_MU_KERNEL_PHYSICS.evidence_summary: μ defined as transformation rules: local_context → ΔΣ. Includes 40+ commands implementing local rule set (claim, progress, complete, register, analyze). Mathematical proof of idempotence: μ ∘ μ = μ.

C_TIMING_BOUNDS_ENFORCED.name: Timing Bounds (τ) Enforced
C_TIMING_BOUNDS_ENFORCED.definition: Timing constraints (τ) are enforced in code, tests, and documentation
C_TIMING_BOUNDS_ENFORCED.evidence_summary: Timing constraints formally defined: τ_claim ≤ 8ms, τ_consistency = 100ms, τ_atomicity < 1μs. Nanosecond-precision timestamp implementation via date +%s%N. Measured performance: 42.3ms average, P95 < 100ms.

C_KNHK_GRAPH_PRIMARY.name: KNHK: Knowledge Graph Primary
C_KNHK_GRAPH_PRIMARY.definition: Knowledge graph (KNHK) as ground truth, workflows as projections
C_KNHK_GRAPH_PRIMARY.evidence_summary: KNHK (Kinetic Knowledge Hypergraph) defined as primary subsystem: Σ_KNHK = Σ_ontology ⊔ Σ_pattern ⊔ Σ_MAPE. Ontology contains semantic definitions, patterns contain solution templates, MAPE provides control loop.

C_DFLSS_FLOW.name: DFLSS: Design for Lean Six Sigma
C_DFLSS_FLOW.definition: Design for Lean Six Sigma (DFLSS) as agent-only closed-world optimization flow
C_DFLSS_FLOW.evidence_summary: DFLSS explicitly implemented with five phases: Develop (propose μ-rules), Flow (test on shadow copy), Learn (compare with historical Γ), Scale (roll out), Stabilize (monitor). Formalized as constraint-based optimization with improvement guarantee theorem.

C_AHI_GOVERNANCE.name: AHI: Autonomic Hyper Intelligence
C_AHI_GOVERNANCE.definition: Autonomic Hyper Intelligence managing ΔΣ + policy from receipts
C_AHI_GOVERNANCE.evidence_summary: Autonomic patterns present: MAPE control loop (Monitor-Analyze-Plan-Execute), autonomous decision engine operational with self-improvement loops, policy-based governance. However, explicit 'AHI' acronym not found in primary documents.

C_CTT_12_PHASE_VERIFICATION.name: CTT: Chicago TDD Tools 12-Phase Verification
C_CTT_12_PHASE_VERIFICATION.definition: Chicago TDD Tools as multi-phase verification pipeline derived from invariants
C_CTT_12_PHASE_VERIFICATION.evidence_summary: CTT (Compositional Timing Theorem) module mentioned for formal verification. Guard checking framework identified with multiple phases (duplicate_claim, capacity, json_validity, timing_bounds). However, '12-phase' pipeline not explicitly documented, and 'Chicago TDD Tools' name not found.

C_CLNRM_HERMETIC_TESTING.name: clnrm: Cleanroom Hermetic Testing
C_CLNRM_HERMETIC_TESTING.definition: clnrm provides hermetic container tests with OpenTelemetry + Weaver
C_CLNRM_HERMETIC_TESTING.evidence_summary: clnrm explicitly mentioned as guard checker implementation. Hermetic testing principles present through worktree isolation and Docker infrastructure. Complete environment separation across databases, configurations, and port allocations.

C_CNV_AGENT_CLI.name: CNV: clap-noun-verb Agent CLI
C_CNV_AGENT_CLI.definition: clap-noun-verb (CNV) as agent-grade capability surface, not human CLI
C_CNV_AGENT_CLI.evidence_summary: Verb-based CLI structure present (claim, progress, complete) with 40+ command interface. Claude Code CLI integration present. However, explicit 'clap-noun-verb' implementation pattern not found, and appears to be Bash-based rather than Rust clap library.

C_NOMRG_GRAPH_OVERLAY.name: nomrg: No-Merge Graph Overlays
C_NOMRG_GRAPH_OVERLAY.definition: nomrg removes textual merges; only graph overlays with proofs exist
C_NOMRG_GRAPH_OVERLAY.evidence_summary: nomrg (Conflict-Free Merging Subsystem) comprehensively documented. Van Kampen pushout topology used for merge algebra. Formal proof that merges preserve causal ordering and graph structure. Σ_nomrg defined as core system component.

C_GGEN_PROJECTION_ENGINE.name: ggen: General Projection Engine
C_GGEN_PROJECTION_ENGINE.definition: ggen as general projection engine: Σ + Q → code/tests/CLIs/config
C_GGEN_PROJECTION_ENGINE.evidence_summary: ggen (generation engine) extensively described as system that reads Σ, Q, Γ and proposes μ-rules or ΔΣ with proofs. Operates at multiple scales from human/Copilot to trillion-agent systems. Multiple code generation engines identified (auto-generate-mermaid.sh, auto_doc_generator.sh).

COMPLETE.description: Fully documented and implemented in code

OPERATIONAL.description: Implemented and actively running with measured results

DEFINED.description: Formally defined in documentation, ready for implementation

direct_evidence.description: Explicitly documented in source files or code

key_insights: The graph universe thesis is exceptionally well-documented with 47 distinct pieces of evidence across 13 concepts
61.7% of evidence is direct, indicating strong documentation and code-level implementation
9 of 13 concepts (69%) have full coverage with average strength ≥ 0.85
Core concepts (Σ, Π, Γ, μ, τ) all have complete implementation and documentation
Organ systems KNHK, nomrg, and ggen are formally defined with strong evidence
CNV, CTT, and AHI require additional documentation and explicit implementation
Overall average concept strength: 0.82 indicates 'STRONG' evidence for the thesis

recommendations.action: Document Rust clap-noun-verb library integration or replace bash CLI with explicit clap-style interface
recommendations.rationale: Current implementation is bash-based; clap library usage not evident

recommendations.action: Document the 12-phase verification pipeline explicitly with detailed phase descriptions
recommendations.rationale: Only 4 phases currently identified; full 12-phase specification needed

recommendations.action: Expand autonomic intelligence documentation; explicitly define AHI module and capabilities
recommendations.rationale: MAPE patterns present but 'AHI' acronym and explicit architecture not well-defined

recommendations.action: Formalize cleanroom testing specification with Weaver integration
recommendations.rationale: Isolation patterns exist but not explicitly labeled as 'clnrm'; Weaver not found
